title: Prevailing rainy condition expected to reduce from today
byline: The prevailing showery condition over the island is expected to be reduced from today (04), the Department of Meteorology says.

title: Sri Lanka defends sovereignty at UNHRC, rejects external human rights mechanisms
byline: Sri Lanka has reiterated the rejection of Resolutions 46/1, 51/1, and 57/1 and the external evidence gathering mechanism on Sri Lanka passed by the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) during the 58th Session of the council as the country concerned following the Oral Update on Sri Lanka by the High Commissioner for Human Rights.

title: Sri Lanka to resume maize imports
byline: The government may have to resume maize imports in the near future despite the current suspension, Minister of Livestock, Land, and Irrigation K.D. Lalkantha stated during a recent parliamentary committee meeting.

title: Pope Francis suffers new breathing crises, Vatican says
byline: Pope Francis suffered two new acute respiratory crises Monday and was put back on noninvasive mechanical ventilation, in another setback to his battle to fight pneumonia, the Vatican said.

title: Cop arrested for supplying T-56 ammunition in Middeniya triple murder
byline: A Police Constable attached to the Weeraketiya Police Station has been arrested in connection with the recent triple murder in Middeniya, police confirmed.

title: New Chief of Staff of Sri Lanka Air Force appointed
byline: Air Vice Marshal Lasitha Sumanaweera has been appointed as the new Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF).

title: Petroleum distributors to hold talks with CPC Chairman today
byline: A discussion between the Petroleum Distributors and the Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) is scheduled to take place at 9.00 a.m. today (04).

title: ‘Sri Lanka will soon be more attractive to remain, not leave or emigrate’ - IMF’s Peter Breuer
byline: International Monetary Fund’s (IMF) Senior Mission Chief for Sri Lanka Peter Breuer commended Sri Lanka’s economic recovery in the recent years, and stated that as economic opportunities return to Sri Lanka, income will be increased and poverty will be reduced making it more attractive for the people to remain in Sri Lanka, not leave...

title: UNHRC: Core Group on Sri Lanka urges new govt for action on human rights
byline: A joint report evaluating Sri Lanka’s recent political and human rights developments has been submitted to the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) by Sri Lanka Core Group led by the United Kingdom.

title: Person injured in shooting at coconut estate in Kuliyapitiya
byline: A man has been injured in a shooting incident in Kuliyapitiya and admitted to Kuliyapitiya Hospital for treatment.

title: Govt assures uninterrupted supply of essential food items for New Year season
byline: In order to make policy decisions related to ensuring food security, Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation K.D. Lalkantha, along with Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development Wasantha Samarasinghe...

title: Sri Lanka should avoid tax exemptions, focus on passing budget: IMF
byline: Sri Lanka should avoid tax exemptions and focus on passing a national budget that is in line with parameters set by the International Monetary Fund to continue with a $2.9 billion program from the international lender, an IMF official said on Tuesday.

title: Police uncover another crime committed by suspected shooter in ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ killing
byline: Sri Lanka Police have uncovered another crime committed by the suspected shooter in the killing of the notorious underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, also known as “Ganemulla Sanjeewa” inside Hulftsdorp Courts Complex in February.

title: Govt adopts “Rich Country - Beautiful Life” policy statement as national policy framework
byline: ​The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to adopt the National Peoples’ Power (NPP) policy statement “A Rich Country – A Beautiful Life” as the government’s national policy framework.

title: Court order issued against unemployed graduates’ protest
byline: A court order has been issued preventing the holding of a protest planned by a group of activists of the Unemployed Graduates’ Association, who have passed the Teachers’ Examination but are yet to secure employment, in a manner that inconvenience the general public.

title: Tax on digital service exporters not unfair – Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Economic Development Prof. Anil Jayantha Fernando states that all citizens of the country, including both individuals and businesses, are required to pay taxes.

title: Cabinet approves development of 24 oil tanks at Trincomalee upper tank farm
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the development of 24 oil tanks at the Trincomalee upper tank farm.

title: Acting Weligama OIC surrenders to court over shooting incident
byline: The Acting Officer-In-Charge (OIC) of the Weligama Police Station has surrendered to the court this morning (04).

title: Extremist group identified in Eastern Province: Cabinet Spokesperson
byline: Cabinet Spokesperson, Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa revealed that intelligence have been received about an extremist organization operating in the Kalmunai area of the Eastern Province.

title: Trump pauses military aid to Ukraine after Oval Office argument with Zelensky
byline: President Donald Trump is ordering a pause on shipments of US military aid to Ukraine after his heated Oval Office argument with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky last week, a White House official told CNN Monday.

title: Youth injured in minor explosion in Kattankudy
byline: A 23-year-old youth has sustained critical injuries following a minor explosion while attempting to open an object found floating in the seas off Arayampathy in the Kattankudy police division.

title: Fuel distributors agree on new formula by CPC – Cabinet Spokesman
byline: The Cabinet Media Spokesperson, Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, says that fuel distributors have expressed their agreement to the new commission formula presented by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC).

title: Immunoglobulin scandal: Former Add. Health Secretary’s petition dismissed
byline: The Supreme Court has dismissed a Fundamental Rights (FR) petition filed by Saman Ratnayake, a former Additional Secretary to the Ministry of Health, seeking a ruling that his fundamental human rights were violated through ‘unlawfully’ arresting and remanding him in custody...

title: Illegally imported foreign cigarettes worth Rs 1.2 billion destroyed
byline: Steps have been taken to destroy a large stock of foreign cigarettes worth Rs. 1.2 billion that was illegally smuggled into the country last year without paying the required customs duty, Sri Lanka Customs said.

title: Cabinet approves land grant for Siyambalanduwa solar project
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to allocate 219.7233 hectares of land as a grant to the Sri Lanka Sustainable Energy Authority (SLSEA) to facilitate the swift commencement of the Siyambalanduwa 100 MW Solar Power Park project.

title: Deadline for postal voting applications for LG polls announced
byline: The Election Commission has announced that the deadline for accepting applications for postal voting in the upcoming Local Government (LG) elections will end at midnight on 12 March 2025 (Wednesday).

title: Acting Weligama OIC granted bail after surrendering to court
byline: The Acting Officer-In-Charge (OIC) of the Weligama Police Station has been granted bail after surrendering to the court this morning (04).

title: ASPI drop nearly 300 points to fall below 16,000 mark
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) has dropped below the 16,000-point mark today (04).

title: GMOA calls off planned island-wide strike
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to call off the island-wide strike that was planned to commence tomorrow (05).

title: GMOA temporarily calls off planned island-wide strike
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to temporarily call off the island-wide strike that was planned to commence tomorrow (05).

title: Australian whose blood saved 2.4 million babies dies
byline: One of the world’s most prolific blood donors - whose plasma saved the lives of more than two million babies - has died.

title: Youth arrested at BIA with mobile phones worth Rs. 30 million
byline: Sri Lankan Customs officers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake have arrested a passenger who arrived in the country with a stock of illegally smuggled high-end mobile phones valued at around Rs. 30 million.

title: Trump and TSMC announce $100 billion plan to build five new US factories
byline: Taiwan semiconductor company TSMC plans to make a fresh $100 billion investment in the United States that involves building five additional chip facilities there in coming years, its CEO announced with President Donald Trump on Monday.

title: ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder: Police increase reward for information on female accomplice
byline: The Police Headquarters has announced a cash reward of Rs. 1.2 million for anyone who provides accurate information leading to the apprehension of the female accomplice, who continues to evade arrest, after being involved in the murder of notorious underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, also known as ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’.

title: Govt. to empower 1.5 million ‘Aswesuma’ beneficiaries in next 5 years
byline: Minister of Rural Development, Social Security and Community Empowerment (Dr.) Upali Pannilage, stated that instead of providing long-term welfare benefits to low-income earners, the Ministry is primarily focused on empowering the majority of them.

title: Japanese Ambassador meets CIABOC Chairman to discuss support for SL’s anti-corruption efforts
byline: The Ambassador of Japan to Sri Lanka, Akio Isomata along with his team, has paid a courtesy call on Justice W.M.N.P. Iddawala, Chairman of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), today (04), at the CIABOC office in Colombo.

title: New DG appointed to Disaster Management Center
byline: Major General (Retired) Sampath Kotuwegoda has been appointed as the new Director General of the Disaster Management Center (DMC).

title: Clifford Chance committed to advising Sri Lanka through final stages of debt restructuring
byline: As the IMF Executive Board recently approved Sri Lanka’s Third Review of its IMF-supported program, Clifford Chance says it remains committed to advising Sri Lanka through the final stages of its debt restructuring process in 2025.

title: Women must lead to shape Sri Lanka’s future – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the qualitative change required for a new society should begin within ourselves and that the government has planned to develop cooperatives suited to the modern world while strengthening the rural economy.

title: TN fishermen call off strike, thank CM for enhancing aid for owners of boats seized by SL Navy
byline: Fishermen of Rameswaram on Tuesday ended their eight-day long strike, a day after Chief Minister M K Stalin hiked the financial aid to fishermen whose boats were impounded in Sri Lanka and assistance for families of fishermen languishing in the island nation’s jail.
